DataFrameLoader

class Melodie.dataframe_loader.DataFrameLoader(manager, config: Melodie.config.Config, scenario_cls: ClassVar[Melodie.scenario_manager.Scenario])

Bases: object

TableLoader loads tables Simulator/Trainer/Calibrator will have reference to TableLoader for loading tables without defining tables multiple times.

generate_scenarios(manager_type: str) → List[Melodie.scenario_manager.Scenario]

Generate scenario objects by the parameter from static tables or scenarios_dataframe. :return:

generate_scenarios_from_dataframe(df_name: str) → List[Melodie.scenario_manager.Scenario]

Generate scenario objects by the parameter from static tables :return:

load_dataframe(table_name: str, file_name: str, data_types: dict) → None

Register static table, saving it to self.registered_dataframes. The static table will be copied into database.

If the scenarios/agents parameter tables can also be registered by this method.

Parameters

  • table_name – The table name, and same the name of table in database. Table name should be an identifier.

  • file_name – The excel filename. if ends with .xls or .xlsx, This file will be searched at Config.excel_folder

  • data_types – Type information in a dict

Returns

register_dataframe(table_name: str, data_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, data_types: Optional[dict] = None) → None
Parameters

  • table_name –

  • data_frame –

  • data_types –

Returns

register_generated_dataframes() → None

The “agent_params” table can be registered in this method.

abstract register_scenario_dataframe() → None

This method must be overriden. The “scenarios” table will be registered in this method.

register_static_dataframes() → None

The “agent_params” table can be registered in this method.

setup()
table_generator(table_name: str, rows_in_scenario: Union[int, Callable[[Melodie.scenario_manager.Scenario], int]])

Create a new generator :param table_name: :param rows_in_scenario:

How many rows will be generated for a specific scenario. This argument should be an integer as number of rows for each scenario, or a function with a parameter typed Scenario and return an integer for how many rows to generate for this scenario .

Returns
